resources.string:
Tap, Tap 将一直保持自由且开源. 任何人都可以在 GitHub 上查看源码。 官方下载渠道只有 XDA， GitHub 和 APKMirror。
如果您允许此应用程序访问互联网，将始终自动从 GitHub 下载更新。
请只在上方提供的官方渠道下载使用 Tap, Tap. 如果您从任何其他渠道下载，强烈建议您卸载并从上方提供的官方链接重新安装。点击以获取更多信息。
Tap, Tap 将使用无障碍服务。 这使应用程序可以在您的设备上自动执行操作，您不应该授予任何不受信任的应用程序此权限。这就是为什么 Tap, Tap 是开源的 - 这样，任何人都可以查阅代码，并检查是否有任何恶意行为。若您从任何第三方渠道下载此应用程序，我们将无法保证您所下载的副本是否安全。所以我们强烈建议您从官方渠道下载安装此应用程序。
如果您喜欢 Tap, Tap，并想要捐赠开发者，您可以点击设置页面下方的 "更多" 按钮。无论您是否捐赠，我们都非常感谢您分享、支持和使用 Tap, Tap 谢谢你!

选择最适合您设备的机型代号。
已选择: %1$s
如果手势无效，请更换机型再试。
双击手机背面来使用此手势。\n试试用食指用力点击吧！
没有作用？尝试在手势配置面板中改变设备大小和灵敏度
很好，点击以继续！\n提示：如果您在使用手势时有困难，你可以在手势配置面板中调整大小和敏感度，或者稍后在设置中调整。
动作和门槛在第一次使用时也许需要适当的权限以生效，查看通知来配置权限
这将只用于定期检查设备配置和应用程序更新
只在此应用程序运行时允许
你的设备没有所需要的的传感器（陀螺仪）来使用此应用程序。Tap, Tap 将无法在此设备上运行。
您已在设备上启用了系统提供的快速点击功能，请禁用它，否则 Tap, Tap 将无法正常工作。快速点击功能也许可以在系统设置中的 系统 > 手势 下找到。
你可能需要在禁用系统自带的快速点击后重新启动，以使 Tap, Tap 的某些功能发挥作用。
关闭电池优化\n来确保 Tap, Tap 不会在后台被杀掉, 点击以关闭此应用的电池优化配置
设置双击手机背面后所执行的动作
设置三击手机背面后所执行的动作
禁止手势在某些情况下被识别并激活动作
>定制设备在识别到手势时通知您的方式
当识别到手势并执行动作时，振动一次
当屏幕处于关闭状态时唤醒设备
当勿扰模式启动时振动
忽略设备的勿扰模式状态，触发时总是振动
动作，即是当您敲击设备的背面两次时所运行的任务。在满足相应条件的情况下，动作会按照列表的顺序从上到下运行。\n点击获取更多信息。
动作，即是当您敲击设备的背面两次时所运行的任务，它按照列表的顺序从上到下运行。如果某个动作已成功运行，则剩余的动作不会被运行。但是，如果一个动作处于不可用状态（例如：在已经启动了语音助手的情况下想要执行「启动语音助手」动作，亦或是没有满足条件），那么它下面的下一个动作将会被运行，以此类推，直到有一个动作成功运行为止。
注：启用三击时，双击动作的响应速度可能会较慢。这是因为在运行该操作之前，它必须等待看是否会执行第三次点击。
未设置三击动作，点击以设置
未设置双击动作，点击以设置
未设置判定条件，点击以设置
运行一个应用程序，捷径，程序捷径
截图、切换手电筒、打开应用抽屉或接听 / 拒接通话。
模拟按键，如主页、后退、任务视图或电源等
控制音乐，改变音量或控制闹铃
模拟上、下、左或右方向的手势动作
无障碍的具体操作，如谷歌语音访问和显示无障碍按钮选择器
触发 Tasker 任务和事件
需要 Shizuku 应用程序或 sui
需要 Tasker 应用程序
需要 Snapchat 应用程序
门槛即是当设备处于特定情况下时，若识别到手势，则不运行对应动作。若是想要不受约束地运行任何一个动作，您必须启用所有的门槛。\n点击获取更多信息。
门槛可以阻止应用在识别到手势时运行动作。为了能够运行所有的动作，您必须启用所有的门槛。\n如果当前满足某个场景，例如：屏幕处于关闭状态，而「屏幕关闭时」处于启用状态时，则不会运行任何动作。您可以添加任意数量的门槛，并使用开关来启用或者禁用它们（没有必要删掉它们再重新添加），以节省时间并提高效率。
对设备变化做出反应，如屏幕、充电和 USB 状态。
对传感器数据做出反应，例如当设备在你的口袋里，或平放在桌子上时。
对与音频有关的事件作出反应，例如正在通话或播放音乐。
对正在打开的应用程序做出反应，包括键盘和相机。
对不起，此门槛无法适用于您的设备 (%1s).
未设置门槛，点击以设置。
在选择手势模型时，调整要使用的设备大小。
当启用低功耗模式时，该选项不可用。
Run the gesture detection on the low-power Context Hub, rather than using the regular CPU to save battery
通过调整「噪音」过滤掉的力度来改变手势的灵敏度。较低的灵敏度意味着在大多数设备上较难激活，而较高的灵敏度则意味着容易被误激活。
已在高级设置中设置了自定义灵敏度，重新设置它以使用此选项。
对 Tap, Tap 手势使用较低的灵敏度，使其更难运行。

Low Power Mode uses the device's "Context Hub", which allows for running "nanoapps" on the low-power CPU. For this to work, there must be the Columbus nanoapp compiled for your device installed, which has to be done by the OEM. Tap, Tap is then able to use this app, in the same way that the system Quick Tap feature does, to detect the gesture in a significantly more power efficient way.

Shizuku (or alternatively sui) is also required for this option, as it requires system permissions not available to user apps.
On Android 13 or above, Sui is required due to platform changes beyond Tap, Tap's control.

Note: You may need to reboot after enabling this option for the first time for it to take effect.

Shizuku or sui is required for this option to work. Shizuku will work without root, but if your device is rooted, it will be able to start automatically on boot. If you are using the sui Magisk module, tap below to request permission.

Sorry, this option is not compatible with your device\nNote: If you are running Android 13 or above, you must be rooted and use Sui to use this option, Shizuku is no longer acceptable due to platform changes outside of Tap, Tap\'s control.
Shizuku is not running, start it to enable Low Power Mode

Newest models are from Android 12 and are more accurate than the legacy models.\n\nNote: Sometimes the closest size is not the best for your device, you may need to try all the sizes to find the one that is best for you.

Legacy models are from Android 11 and are less accurate than the newer models.\n\nNote: Sometimes the closest size is not the best for your device, you may need to try all the sizes to find the one that is best for you.
Advanced settings and tweaks to change performance and more
These settings are experimental and may not work on your device, or may cause Tap, Tap to stop working entirely.
Attempt to automatically restart the Tap, Tap listener component once an hour.
Use the legacy method of waking the device with the \'Wake Device\' option enabled. This may not work on all devices, but may be more reliable in a few rare cases.
Runs the Tensor model on the low power CPU if available; disable if you have performance issues or the gesture stops working entirely.
Choose the colour from your wallpaper to use throughout Tap, Tap\'s UI
Set a custom sensitivity value for the gesture.\nImportant: Only use this if none of the built in sensitivity values are working for you
Wallpaper Color Picker unavailable for the currently selected wallpaper
Backup your settings to your device or the cloud
Backup your settings to your device or the cloud
Restore your settings from your device or the cloud
This will only be used to retrieve device specifications and to check for updates
Show a notification if Tap, Tap crashes, allowing saving of a log to report on GitHub or XDA. This option does not automatically send crash data to a server.
Info on why Tap, Tap uses battery, and why it may be killed by your device when run in the background (and how to fix that)

Tap, Tap uses sensor data in the background, which can be CPU and battery intensive. On devices with a dedicated ML accelerator (such as those with a Qualcomm Hexagon Tensor Accelerator), you may see a smaller battery impact.
Tap here for some battery saving tips.

Tap, Tap requires the Android battery optimisation be disabled for the app. This helps prevent it being killed in the background.
Note: On some devices, you may also need to disable extra settings to prevent the app being killed. Tap here for more info.
Android Battery Optimisation for Tap, Tap is enabled
Android Battery Optimisation for Tap, Tap is disabled
Your device appears to have some OEM-specific battery optimisations. Tap, Tap is unable to automatically request to disable them, please check your settings to verify they are disabled.
There was an error saving your backup: %1s
There was an error restoring your backup
Some actions, gates or requirements require additional setup or are incompatible with your device, please check them before continuing.
\'Columbus\' Model and base code created by Google, from Android 11 Developer Preview 1 and Android 12 (Apache License 2.0)

Tasker integration: João Dias
Music control actions: timfedo
MD2 UI and Chrome Custom Tabs: Giorgio Cantoni
Power Dialog action: Adrian Campos
DND feedback and Sound Profiles action: Ashutosh Singh
Launch Search action: arkon
Force Do not Disturb action: Kylian Meulin

Icons by Material Icons (Apache Licence 2.0)
Material Design Icons (Pictogrammers Free Licence)
Freepik (Flaticon Licence)
Vitaly Gorbachev (Flaticon Licence)
Launch your default camera app. This action will be skipped if the camera is already running.
Launch Snapchat\'s Quick Tap to Snap feature, if available (this action may require some additional setup).
Open the recents by simulating pressing the recents button. On devices that support it, using this action when recents is already open will switch to the first backgrounded app
Open the notification shade. On supported devices, this will close the notification shade if it\'s open.
Open the quick settings shade. On supported devices, this will close the quick settings shade if it\'s open
Take a screenshot using the system screenshot UI
Lock the screen by simulating the power button being pressed
Opens the power dialog by simulating the power button being held
Show the Device (Home) controls, as if the Quick Settings tile has been clicked
Show the Quick Access Wallet, as if the Quick Settings tile has been clicked
Simulate clicking a Quick Setting tile
Toggle the flashlight. This action will fail if the camera is in use by another app.
Launch %1s. This action will be skipped if it is already running.
Show the system volume panel with the sound stream for adjustment showing
Increase the volume of the current sound stream
Decrease the volume of the current sound stream
Turn mute on/off for the current sound stream
Wake the device up if the screen is off. This overrides the setting in the feedback settings, is skipped if the display is on, and will not work if you have the \"Display off\" gate enabled
Switch between sound profiles of your device: Vibrate/Silent/Loud
Force sound profile of your device: Silent
Launch a shortcut such as Google Maps directions
This shortcut is currently not supported
Launch an App Shortcut, usually a deep link into an app such as a chat conversation
Start or stop split screen mode with the current app (does not work when on the homescreen)

Experimental: Launch a reachbility-esque mode using split screen, with an empty top half of the screen and the current app on the bottom. Note: You may be required to reopen the current app when starting and ending this mode
Simulate a camera button press, taking a photo if the camera is open (supported camera apps only)
Triggers the Google Voice Access accessibility app, if it is running (this is NOT assistant or voice search)

This action presses the screen at the position the hamburger menu usually is.\nImportant warning: This will tap anything at the position where the menu usually is (top left), so will also sometimes go back, and may even tap other elements on the screen in that position, including other buttons. Use with extreme caution, consider using triple tap and app requirements to limit it.
Simulate the accessibility button, which can be used to trigger other services such as Select to Speak
Bring up the Accessibility Button\'s chooser menu
Trigger the Accessibility Shortcut. Make sure Tap, Tap is not set to use the shortcut before using this action!
Open the app drawer of a supported launcher. This only works on launchers based on Android 11.
Accept call if there is one ringing
Reject call if there is one ringing, or hang up if there is one ongoing
Perform a swipe up gesture on the current app
Perform a swipe down gesture on the current app
Perform a swipe left gesture on the current app
Perform a swipe right gesture on the current app
Sorry, this action is not compatible with your device (%1s).
Switch to the most recent app by simulating double tapping the recents button (supported devices only)
Dismisses an alarm or timer, if there is one going off (supported Clock apps only)
Snoozes an alarm, if there is one going off (supported Clock apps only)
Incompatible with your version of Android
Blocks gesture when the device is plugged in
Run only when the device has just been plugged in
Blocks gesture when the device is on a call. Only standard calls are supported - not VoIP eg. WhatsApp
Run only when the device is on a call
Blocks gesture when a USB device, such as a thumb drive, is plugged in
Run only when a USB device has just been plugged in
Blocks gesture when any camera app is opened. Note: This will break the skipping functionality of the Launch Camera action.
Run only when the camera app is open
Blocks gesture when the device\'s screen is off
Run only when the screen is off
Blocks gesture when the device\'s screen is on
Run only when the screen is on
Blocks gesture when an app is showing on screen
Run only when an app is showing on screen
Blocks gesture when %1s is showing on screen
Blocks gesture when the keyboard is open and in use. Note that this may not always work if you are not actively typing.
Run only when the keyboard is open and in use. Note that this may not always work if you are not actively typing.
Blocks gesture when the phone is in landscape orientation
Run only when the device is in landscape orientation
Blocks gesture when the phone is in portrait orientation
Run only when the device is in portrait orientation
Blocks the gesture when the device is placed down flat, for example on a table
Run only when the device is flat, for example on a table
Blocks the gesture when the proximity sensor detects an object. This blocks the gesture when your device is in your pocket, or flipped on a table
Run only when the proximity sensor detects an object. This happens when the device is in your pocket, or flipped on a table
Blocks the gesture when there is no wired or wireless headset connected. This is best used with the play/pause/skip controls to prevent music from playing over the speakers
Run only when there is no wired or wireless headset connected
Blocks the gesture when there is a wired or wireless headset connected.
Run only when there is a wired or wireless headset connected
Blocks the gesture when there is music playing
Run only when there is music playing
Run only when there is no music playing
Blocks the gesture when there is no music playing
Blocks gesture when the lock screen is showing
Run only when the lock screen is showing
Blocks the gesture when the lock screen is not showing
Run only when the lock screen is not showing
Blocks the gesture if an alarm or timer is going off
Run only when an alarm or timer is going off
Blocks the gesture if the device is folded / closed
Run only when the device is folded / closed
Blocks the gesture if the device is unfolded / open
Run only when the device is unfolded / open
Blocks the gesture when the device has less than 15% battery remaining
Run only when the device has less than 15% battery remaining
Blocks the gesture when the system Battery Saver is enabled
Run only when the system Battery Saver is enabled
Incompatible with your version of Android
Tap, Tap is running in the background. Tap to hide.
Notification used to keep Tap, Tap running in the background when the option to use a separate service is enabled
Notifications about actions, including errors while running them
Camera permission required, tap to open settings.
Draw Over Other Apps Permission Required
This action requires the Draw Over Other apps permission, due to system limitations. Tap to grant permission.
This action requires the Accessibility Service, tap to enable. If you are seeing this when it is enabled, disable and re-enable the service.
This gate requires the Accessibility Service, tap to enable. If you are seeing this when it is enabled, disable and re-enable the service.
This action requires the Gesture Accessibility Service, tap to enable. If you are seeing this when it is enabled, disable and re-enable the service.
Notifications about the service, including loading and errors
Unable to connect to Shizuku, please make sure it is running and then retry.
Permission denied when connecting to Shizuku, please grant Tap, Tap permission in Shizuku and then retry.
Make sure you have granted root access to Tap, Tap
Notifications when Tap, Tap crashes to save errors
Tap to view the crash details and export a log to be sent on GitHub or XDA. You can disable crash notifications in Tap, Tap\'s settings.
Notifications shown when the app checks for updates once a day
An update is available for Tap, Tap (%1s to %1s)
Error getting App Shortcuts, please try again. If the problem persists, restart Shizuku using ADB.
This may take up to 10 seconds

Shizuku or Sui were not found on your device, you will need to install one of them to use this %s.\n\nNote: If you already have Shizuku or Sui, make sure it is running (Shizuku only), that you have not denied the permission, and retry.

Shizuku is a non-root app that allows apps like Tap, Tap to run code with special permissions. It does this by running a command on ADB (Android Debug Bridge) Shell, once per reboot. On Android 11+ devices, this can be done without a computer, but on older versions you will need to connect to a computer once per reboot to restart Shizuku.

Sui is a Magisk module that allows apps like Tap, Tap to run code as root. It uses the same framework as Shizuku, and therefore works with Shizuku apps, but does not require manual starting after reboots, this is done automatically.\nIf you are not sure what root or Magisk is, use Shizuku instead.
Please grant root access if requested

To enable Quick Tap to Snap on your device, please follow these steps:
You must be signed into Snapchat for this to work
1.) Disable your internet connection - both WiFi and mobile data (use Airplane Mode ideally). Do not re-enable it until you have completed these steps.
2.) Select the option below to open Snapchat - you must use this button as it has to open with certain options to show the prompt.
3.) Snapchat will open and prompt you to unlock to complete setting up - this is normal, simply OK the dialog.
4.) A dialog will appear asking you to enable Quick Tap to Snap, enable it. You will not see a system prompt to enable it, this is normal.
5.) Return to Tap, Tap by closing Snapchat to complete setup.

To setup Quick Tap to Snap, there are a few steps to follow. These steps require rebooting your phone and re-activating the system Quick Tap gesture temporarily (which will prevent access to Tap, Tap until the steps are finished), so they have been put on an external site to make them more accessible.
Sorry, Quick Tap to Snap requires root access to be enabled on your device.
Error getting availability, please try again
Please disable WiFi and mobile data first

Due to system limitations, there are some restrictions:
- Quick Settings tiles' titles cannot be retrieved, so please refer to your notification shade to match against the order.
- Only custom tiles can be clicked, not the stock ones such as Internet
- On some devices, the tile must be on page 1 or 2 of your quick settings for the click to work.
Sorry, root access was not detected or was not granted. You must be rooted to use this action.
You need to grant Tap, Tap the \"Phone\" permission to use this shortcut Action. Please grant it in your device\'s permission settings
Please grant the %1s permission in the settings to continue.
Please grant the display over other apps permission for Tap, Tap
Please enable the \"Allow External Access\" option in Tasker\'s settings.
Long press the notification icon to switch icon position
Will trigger when the back of the phone is tapped three times
Will trigger when the back of the phone is tapped twice
Tap, Tap Accessibility Service\n\nImportant Note: No data is collected from any of your apps, this service is simply used to keep the recognition active and provide interaction with the device

Tap, Tap Gesture Accessibility Service. 

You don't need to enable this if the app does not tell you to. It's only required for certain actions.

Important Note: No data is collected from any of your apps, this service is simply used to provide the gesture interaction with the device.

This is a separate service due to how Android works and how apps adapt their UI when services that can perform gestures are enabled. For example, Chrome will not hide the Omnibar on scroll with this service enabled.

Tap, Tap has encountered a crash. Please report the issue, including the report, on the GitHub issues or XDA thread. If the crash happened when running the gesture, an action or using a gate, please include screenshots of the setup you are using.

Important: Before reporting, please make sure the issue has not been reported already, using the provided search tools.

The report is also shown below.
